column4: Hi everyone. After installing Lucid Lynx, my system frequently crashes (screent turns black, system reboots). Is there a known bug? Also changed from ext2 to ext4. Thanks!
did you take a look into your system  logs?
after bootup verify if some hardware stuff hasnt been detected correctly...use dmesg

system logs are under /var/log/  take a look at files like syslog and messages.......... after a fresh reboot type   dmesg   in  a terminal window....you can see what has been going on at boot time....dmesg | less maybe to pageinate
sr0 is bad.....io stuff can often lead to locked systems
remove disks from your optical drivers
What's sr0? What means "lock up"? To crash? And why do I have an fd0 floppy drive appearing?
if this doesnt help, your drives optical lense may have problems
sr0 in common is the first optical drive on your system
Thanks
And what's the matter with fd0?
whats your system? scsi? sata?

sata. I think I have a BIOS setup which lets SATA drives appear as IDE. Should I turn off this feature? I cannot imagine my optical drive crashing the system since it is quite new and never made any problems with karmic koala.
the cd in it could be damaged too....
but i think something wired is going on....
It's a blank DVD which I haven't used yet.
remove it! blank disks
The system crashes appeared even before inserting this DVD.
just to make sure pls
Just to make sure I get you right: You suggest that keeping the DVD-burner empty whenever possible will prevent the crashs?
try it...it's to find the source of the problem...not ment as a solution
Okay thanks. I will also try to edit my BIOS setup and disable floppy features and this SATA-as-IDE-feature.
